intro: Spermacoce herzogii, commonly known as the African star apple, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in cymes. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, which are often dispersed by wind. Spermacoce herzogii is often found in open woodlands and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
